content: yorkana pullover skill level intermediate sizes a b c d e f g h finished measurements chest bust 32 5 36 5 40 5 44 5 48 5 52 5 56 5 60 5 the sweater is designed to fit with 2-4 of positive ease choose a size that reflects your chest measurement plus the amount of ease you want yoke depth 8 8 8 5 9 9 9 5 10 10 measured from cast on edge straight down center front body from underarm to bottom of ribbing 13 25 sleeve from underarm to bottom of cuff 18 upper sleeve circumference 11 5 12 13 14 25 15 16 17 18 since the sweater is worked top down all length measurements are adjustable fit tips will be given throughout the instructions yarn liverpool yarns fingering 100% shetland wool approx 180 yds/50 g 6 6 7 7 8 9 9 10 skeins color a and 1 1 2 2 2 2 2 2 skeins color b sample shown in straw color a and daylily color b if you want to add length to the body and/or sleeves you will need additional yarn in color a needles for neck us size 2 2 75 mm 16 or 20 circular needle or two sizes smaller than gauge needle for body us size 4 3 5 mm 32 or 40 circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge note if you tend to knit tighter when working stranded knitting you may want to go up a needle size when working that portion of the yoke for bottom ribbing us size 2 2 75 mm 32 or 40 circular needle or two sizes smaller than gauge needle for sleeves us size 4 3 5 mm in your preferred type of needles for working small circumferences or size needed to obtain gauge for bottom sleeve ribbing us size 2 2 75 mm in your preferred type of needles for working small circumferences or two sizes smaller than gauge needle notions removable stitch markers waste yarn yarn needle gauge in stockinette stitch on gauge needle in the round 24 sts and 32 rnds = 4 after blocking 1 abbreviations bor beginning of round decrease s decrease s k knit kfbf knit in the front back and front of stitch k2tog knit 2 together p purl p3tog purl 3 together repeat repeat round s round s rs right side ssk slip 2 sts knitwise knit these 2 sts together through back loops sm slip marker st s stitch es ws wrong side w&t wrap and turn x times yo yarn over notes & techniques sweater is worked seamlessly and in the round from the top down short row raise the back neck the color work yoke is worked then the sleeves and body are separated and worked top to bottom increases are worked as yarn overs on the increase round and knitted through the back loop on the following round when working with more than one color carry
